item.title: Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates: India rings in 2025 with joyful celebrations across the nation - The Indian Express
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations LIVE Updates

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

As the hour strikes midnight, India celebrates the arrival of 2025 with unparalleled enthusiasm and fervor. With vibrant celebrations at every corner, this marks the start of a new year full of hopes, dreams, and possibilities.

  • Major cities across the globe, from Sydney to London, will illuminate the welcome with firework shows.
  • New York is hosting its famous Ball Drop featuring performances from various artists including Kesha, T-Pain, and The Jonas Brothers.
  • In India, police are taking measures for safety, including diversions around Connaught Place and bans on firecrackers in Chennai.
“The atmosphere is one of joy and anticipation.”

This New Year’s celebration reflects not only the joy of the moment but also a hopeful vision for 2025.

item.title: New Year 2025: Are banks closed on January 1, 2025? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Are Banks Closed on New Year's Day 2025?

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Indian Express

As we approach the new year, many citizens are curious about banking operations on January 1, 2025 (Wednesday). Understanding bank holiday schedules is crucial for financial planning and managing personal transactions during the festive season.

  • Banks in India are expected to be open on January 1, 2025, as no clear direction from the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has been issued yet.
  • Bank holidays vary by state; for example, banks in West Bengal will observe a statewide closure on New Year’s Day.
  • Banks will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except in Mizoram and Sikkim.
  • Online banking and ATMs will still be available for cash withdrawals during closures.
“Banks across India will be open on New Year’s Eve, December 31, 2024, except for banks in Mizoram and Sikkim.”

It’s essential to check with local bank branches for their specific holiday calendars to be informed about banking operations during the new year.

item.title: Live Updates | Happy New Year 2025 Celebrations: Countdown To Midnight Begins; India Set To Welcome - Zee News
item.description:
Happy New Year 2025 Live Updates

Publication Date: December 31, 2024
Source: Zee News

As 2024 draws to a close, we stand on the cusp of a brand-new year, ready to welcome 2025 with open arms, symbolizing fresh opportunities and new beginnings.

  • New Year's Day falls on January 1, 2025, which is a Wednesday.
  • The celebrations feature dazzling fireworks and public gatherings in cities around the world.
  • Famous events include the Ball Drop in New York with performances from popular artists.
  • Global cities illuminate the skies with firework displays.
“This transition brings a sense of hope and renewal.”

The arrival of 2025 is marked by celebrations across India and worldwide, gathering people to reflect on the past year and set aspirations for the future.

item.title: 'Serious Breach Of Oath, Insults Constitution': Kerala CM On Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks - News18
item.description:
Kerala CM Condemns Nitesh Rane's 'Mini-Pakistan' Remarks

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: News18

Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan strongly criticized Maharashtra BJP Minister Nitesh Rane for his remarks calling Kerala a 'mini-Pakistan', stating that such comments are a serious breach of oath and insult to the Constitution.

  • The CM labeled Rane's comments as highly provocative and unacceptable.
  • Opposition leaders in Kerala have demanded Rane's resignation over the remarks.
  • CM Vijayan emphasized that such statements are part of a larger hate propaganda by the Sangh Parivar aimed at alienating Kerala.
  • The political controversy sparked by Rane's statement has drawn severe criticism and calls for accountability from opposition parties.
“The minister who made the hateful statement does not deserve to continue in that position.” - Pinarayi Vijayan

The controversy around Nitesh Rane’s remarks reflects ongoing tensions in political discourse in India, especially regarding communal relations and regional perceptions.

item.title: Government websites down after outage at NIC data centre in Delhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Government websites down after outage at NIC data centre in Delhi

Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Several government websites went down on December 31, 2024, due to a power outage at the National Informatics Centre's data centre, impacting services and causing disruptions for the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) website.

  • Government websites went offline following a power outage at NIC data centre in Delhi.
  • IRCTC site disruptions affected last-minute ticket purchases for trains.
  • Other affected websites include those of DoT, MEA, PIB, Ministry of Health, and Ministry of Labour.
  • Some sites remained down until 7.30 PM, while others continued to show error messages.
“The IRCTC site was not accessible during the tatkal booking period…”

As multiple government websites faced outages, the situation highlights the vulnerability of digital infrastructure in the context of public services.

item.title: Jaishankar in Doha for talks, to prepare for Qatari Emir visit in February amidst West Asia outreach - The Hindu
item.description:
Jaishankar in Doha for talks, to prepare for Qatari Emir visit in February amidst West Asia outreach

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 09:12 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar is in Doha for a 3-day visit to prepare for the upcoming visit of Qatar’s Emir Sheikh Tamim ibn Hamad Al Thani to India, amid ongoing tensions in the Gulf region.

  • Jaishankar's visit includes meetings with officials to discuss various diplomatic ties including trade, investment, and security.
  • The Emir is expected to visit India early next month as part of India’s outreach to the Gulf.
  • Jaishankar's visit also raises hope for the return of a former Naval officer detained in Qatar.
  • The family of the detained officer has pleaded with the Indian government for intervention.
“MEA made blunder in leaving my brother alone & now they should not take refuge by citing his financial case.” - Meetu Bhargava, sister of the detained officer

This visit is part of a larger strategy to strengthen ties with the Gulf amidst a crises impacting multiple regions.

item.title: When is Diwali in 2025? Know the dates of Holi, Navratrti, Karwa Chauth and more - Hindustan Times
item.description:
When is Diwali in 2025?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Hindustan Times

The article presents the dates of major festivals for 2025, highlighting Diwali's date, which falls on October 20, 2025, a Monday. The list includes various cultural and religious celebrations throughout the year.

Key Points:

  • Diwali in 2025 is on October 20.
  • Highlights the importance of cultural festivals.
  • Includes a full list of important festival dates throughout 2025.
"Diwali, the festival of colours is celebrated with a lot of pomp and grandeur all over the country every year."

This information serves as a guide to anticipate upcoming festivities in 2025.

item.title: Delhi LG's office replies to Atishi's letter on religious structures: ‘CM playing cheap politics’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi LG's Office Responds to Atishi Over Allegations of Religious Structure Demolitions

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing conflict between Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena and Chief Minister Atishi escalates as Atishi accuses the LG of planning to demolish multiple religious structures. The LG's office denies these claims, asserting that the CM is engaging in political theatrics.

  • Atishi alleged that a religious committee headed by the LG decided to demolish various religious structures, which would hurt the sentiments of communities.
  • The LG's office refuted the claims, stating no demolition orders have been issued.
  • LG emphasized the need for vigilance against vandalism and criticized the CM for attempting to shift focus from governance issues.
  • The exchange included remarks about Atishi being labeled a 'temporary Chief Minister' by the LG, which prompted further debate on the nature of political roles.
“Demolition of these structures would hurt the religious sentiments of these communities.” - Atishi
“CM is playing cheap politics to divert attention from her and her predecessor CM's failures.” - Delhi LG's office

The contentious back-and-forth highlights ongoing tensions in Delhi's political landscape, as allegations and responses focus on governance and accountability.

item.title: Delhi CM Atishi urges LG to stop temple demolitions; Saxena's office calls it 'cheap politics' - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi CM Atishi urges LG to stop temple demolitions; Saxena's office calls it 'cheap politics'

Publication Date: Provided by the source not extracted Source: Times of India

This article discusses the recent request by Delhi Chief Minister Atishi to the Lieutenant Governor to halt potential temple demolitions in the city, which has sparked significant controversy. The LG's office has labeled this appeal as 'cheap politics'.

  • Atishi has urged the LG to prevent temple demolitions in Delhi.
  • The issue has led to accusations of political maneuvering from both sides.
  • The context involves ongoing debates around urban development and religious structures.
“The actions taken are not just wrong but politically motivated,” said Atishi.

In conclusion, the matter highlights escalating tensions between the Delhi government and the Lieutenant Governor, with significant public interest and implications for local governance.

item.title: Over 50 Kuki women hurt in clash with forces in Manipur's Kangpokpi, cops say situation 'under control' - ThePrint
item.description:
Over 50 Kuki Women Hurt in Clash with Forces in Manipur's Kangpokpi

Date: New Delhi

Source: ThePrint

The incident in Saibol village, a protest against security force deployment, resulted in over 50 women injured, including one significant injury from a rubber bullet.

  • More than 50 Kuki women injured in a clash with security forces.
  • The clash occurred during protests against the deployment of Army and paramilitary forces.
  • One woman was hit in the eye by a rubber bullet and is being treated in Guwahati.
  • Protesters alleged the security forces used lathi charge and tear gas to disperse them.
  • CoTU, a local group, has called for an indefinite economic blockade on National Highway 2 in response.
“The security forces must take immediate and decisive action to neutralise and disarm the armed Meitei groups.” - Kuki Inpi

The Chief Minister expressed regret over the ongoing violence in Manipur, urging calm and unity.

item.title: ‘First ever’ glass bridge opened in India's southernmost tip | Key details - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Glass bridge connecting Vivekananda memorial, Thiruvalluvar statue inaugurated in Tamil Nadu

Date: Dec 31, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The newly inaugurated glass bridge in Kanyakumari connects the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and the Thiruvalluvar statue, marking a significant development in Tamil Nadu's tourism.

  • The bridge is 77 meters long, 10 meters wide, and 133 feet high.
  • It is designed to withstand coastal conditions such as saline breezes and high humidity.
  • Previously, tourists had to use a ferry to travel between the two monuments.
“It provides a thrilling experience of walking above the sea,” said a tourist official.

In celebration, Chief Minister MK Stalin announced the last week of December will now be known as “Thrirukkural week” to honor the legacy of the Tamil poet Thiruvalluvar.

item.title: No mercy should be shown: Kerala court sentences ‘tuition’ teacher to 111 years RI for raping school girl - Greater Kashmir
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Achievements of ACB J&K in year 2024 - Cross Town News
item.description:
Achievements of ACB J&K in Year 2024

Date: December 31, 2024

Source: Local News

The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) in Jammu and Kashmir has reported significant achievements in combating corruption throughout the year 2024. A total of 87 FIRs were registered, highlighting the Bureau's commitment to tackling corrupt practices.

  • 87 FIRs were registered: 42 in Jammu division and 45 in Kashmir division.
  • 32 cases were charge-sheeted in court.
  • 23 trap cases and 13 cases of Disproportionate Assets were registered.
  • 42,521 vigilance clearances were issued through an online portal.
  • 16 FIRs were filed against the land mafia and corrupt officials.
  • Internal workshops and capacity-building programs for ACB staff were conducted.
  • Stakeholders were made aware of anti-corruption laws during various awareness weeks.
“Tackling corruption is not just the job of the government and the Anti-Corruption Bureau; individual and collaborative engagement at all levels is required.”

The efforts of the ACB throughout 2024 reflect a strong stance against corruption and emphasize the vital role of citizen participation in reporting corrupt practices.

item.title: Why ailing Dallewal has landed Mann govt in tricky spot despite backing farmers’ stir in Punjab - ThePrint
item.description:
Punjab Government Faces Pressure Amid Farmer Protests as Leader's Health Deteriorates

Publication Date: Not provided Source: The Print

This article discusses the challenges faced by the Bhagwant Mann government as farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal's health worsens during an ongoing protest in Punjab. The Supreme Court has directed the government to intervene while Dallewal refuses medical aid unless the Central government engages with farmers.

  • Farmers are called to gather at Khanauri in response to deteriorating health conditions of Dallewal.
  • The Supreme Court has ordered immediate action from the Punjab government regarding Dallewal's health.
  • Despite the backing of the Punjab government, the Centre has not engaged in talks with protesting farmers.
  • There are tensions between the state government and farmers' leaders over potential force to remove Dallewal.
  • Opposition parties are also urging action to support farmers and ensure their safety.
  • A pan-Punjab bandh was organized to show solidarity with farmer protests.
"Farmers feed the nation, yet they struggle for their own survival. MSP is their legal right, not a privilege!" - Amarinder Singh Raja Warring

The situation remains tense as negotiations between the farmers and the government continue to stall.

item.title: Kerala nurse sentenced to death in Yemen: All you need to know about the case and Indian govt’s response - OpIndia
item.description:
Kerala Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen: All You Need to Know About the Case and Indian Govt’s Response

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 Source: India Today

Indian nurse Nimisha Priya has been sentenced to death in Yemen after being convicted of murder in a 2017 case. The Indian government is exploring options to help her appeal against the sentence.

Nimisha Priya’s Arrest and Case Background

Nimisha Priya was arrested in July 2017 for the murder of Yemeni citizen Talal Abdo Mahdi, with sentencing taking place three years later.

  • The death sentence could potentially be overturned if Mahdi's family agrees to accept blood money.
  • Efforts are underway by her family to negotiate with the victim's family for pardon.
  • The Indian Ministry of External Affairs has stated they are providing all possible support in this matter.

Key Developments in the Case

In a tragic series of disputes, Priya injected Mahdi with sedatives, leading to his death from overdose.

  • Priya had been facing threats and harassment from Mahdi over a failed business partnership.
  • Concerns regarding payment to the lawyer appointed for her defense led to stalled negotiations for blood money.
  • The appeals process in the Yemeni Supreme Court has already been rejected as of November 2023.
“We are aware of the sentencing of Nimisha Priya in Yemen. The government is extending all possible help in the matter.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The case highlights serious concerns regarding legal coercion, rights of foreign nationals in Yemen, and the complexities surrounding international legal assistance.

item.title: In Sandeshkhali, Suvendu Adhikari's "Revenge" Warning To Mamata Banerjee - NDTV
item.description:
Suvendu Adhikari's Strong Warning to Mamata Banerjee in Sandeshkhali

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

West Bengal's Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari visited Sandeshkhali following Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's recent visit, amidst ongoing political tensions related to past allegations in the area.

  • Adhikari warned that a BJP government would investigate allegations made against women in Sandeshkhali.
  • Mamata Banerjee rejected the allegations as falsehoods tied to financial motives.
  • The BJP is likely to feature Rekha Patra, a local candidate, in upcoming bye-elections.
  • Banerjee appealed to women voters to be cautious against misleading information.
“If there is a BJP government formed in the state, there will be a commission on the Sandeshkhali incident...” - Suvendu Adhikari
“Lies don't last long, they are exposed one day.” - Mamata Banerjee

The political landscape in Sandeshkhali remains contentious as both parties prepare for impending bye-elections, making this region a focal point of their campaigns.

item.title: Will banks remain closed on January 1, 2025 New Year? All you need to know - Business Standard
item.description:
Bank Holiday on New Year 2025: Will banks Open or closed on January 1, New Year 2025?

Date & Source: [Publication Date] [Source]

The new year is approaching and many are curious about the bank holidays on January 1, 2025. Most banks across the country will remain closed on New Year's Day, but online services will still be active.

Key Points:

  • Most banks will be closed on January 1, 2025, for New Year.
  • Online banking services and ATMs will remain open.
  • RBI will issue an official holiday calendar for January 2025, anticipating 13 non-working days including two Saturdays and four Sundays.
  • The tentative holiday list includes various regional observances along with the New Year holiday.

Notable Quotes or Statistics:

The Reserve Bank of India considers various regional occasions while announcing the holiday calendar.

Conclusion:

Overall, if you need to conduct banking activities on New Year's Day, be aware that in-person services will be unavailable, but online options remain accessible.

item.title: 'If PM Modi has any shame, he should sack him immediately': KC Venugopal on Nitish Rane's 'mini Pakistan' - The Times of India
item.description:
KC Venugopal Calls for Immediate Action Against Nitish Rane After 'Mini Pakistan' Comment

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Congress leader KC Venugopal has criticized BJP's Nitish Rane for his controversial 'mini Pakistan' remark regarding a minority community, urging PM Modi to take swift action against him.

  • Venugopal claims Rane's comments are inflammatory and aim to create division.
  • He emphasizes the need for respect and unity among communities.
  • The statement has drawn widespread condemnation across various political lines.
'If PM Modi has any shame, he should sack him immediately,' said KC Venugopal.

This incident highlights ongoing tensions in India's political landscape and the necessity for leaders to curb hateful rhetoric.

item.title: 'Biwi bhaag jaegi': Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani weighs in on 70-hour work week debate - OpIndia
item.description:
Gautam Adani on Work-Life Balance: A Humorous Take on 70-Hour Workweeks

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: IANS

In a light-hearted interview, Adani Group chairman Gautam Adani weighed in on the debate surrounding a 70-hour workweek, emphasizing the need for a personalized approach to work-life balance.

  • Gautam Adani humorously suggested that excessive work hours could hurt personal relationships, stating, “biwi bhaag jayegi” (your wife might run away).
  • He stressed that work-life balance varies for each individual and should not be imposed universally.
  • Adani emphasized personal happiness as the core of work-life balance, highlighting the joy found in spending time with family.
  • The comments come in response to Infosys founder NR Narayana Murthy's suggestion to adopt a more demanding work ethic to compete globally.
“Work-life balance is achieved when you do what you enjoy.” - Gautam Adani

In conclusion, Adani encourages individuals to define their own work-life balance based on their unique preferences and personal happiness.

item.title: NC squirms as party MP Aga Ruhullah draws on Quran to Malcolm X, puts Omar govt in dock - The Indian Express
item.description:
NC MP Aga Ruhullah Challenges Omar Abdullah's Government Amid Protests

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: The Indian Express

In a significant turn of events, National Conference MP Aga Ruhullah has emerged as a vocal critic of Chief Minister Omar Abdullah's government, joining protests against new reservation policies that have arisen following the abrogation of Article 370.

  • Ruhullah participated in protests alongside youth against the government's quota changes.
  • His protest participation has led to internal criticism from fellow NC members who accuse him of undermining the party.
  • Ruhullah claims he is responding to the valid concerns of his constituents and reaffirming his commitment to their needs.
  • The MP's rising popularity stems from public sentiment calling for more accountability from NC leadership regarding unfulfilled promises to Jammu and Kashmir.
“Today you still have house Negroes and field Negroes. I’m a field Negro.” - Aga Ruhullah

The significant divide within the National Conference regarding Ruhullah's actions raises questions about the party's cohesion and future direction amidst growing public discontent.

item.title: Bengaluru techie's controversial advice for people in their 20s sparks debate: 'Get a maid, buy a MacBook' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru techie's advice for early 20s sparks social media debate over spending on productivity-enhancing items.

Date: Dec 31, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A Bengaluru techie, Shobhit Shrivastava, has ignited a social media debate with his advice for individuals in their early 20s. He suggests they should invest in items that enhance productivity rather than focusing on saving money.

  • His recommendations include purchasing a MacBook, gym memberships, noise-cancelling headphones, and hiring domestic help.
  • He encourages young adults to overcome money-pinching habits and focus on improving their earning potential.
  • The advice has drawn mixed reactions online, with some praising it while others deem it unrealistic for those with financial responsibilities.
"If you're a person in your early 20s, don't hesitate to spend money on things that improve your productivity. Early 20s is the time to invest in yourself and increase your earning potential."

The conversation around this advice highlights the differing perspectives on financial priorities among young adults today.

item.title: New Year 2025: Delhi Metro announces revised timings at Rajiv Chowk station - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Metro Revises Timings for New Year 2025 Celebrations at Rajiv Chowk Station

Date: December 31, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) announced changes in service at Rajiv Chowk metro station due to New Year 2025 celebrations, allowing it to remain open for passengers until the end of service on December 31, 2024, with some gates closed.

  • Rajiv Chowk station will be open for passengers until the end of services on December 31, except for Gate nos. 5 and 6.
  • QR tickets to Rajiv Chowk will not be issued from 8:00 PM to facilitate smooth operations.
  • Other metro services will continue to operate on the regular timetable.
  • Delhi Police have issued traffic restrictions for popular New Year celebration spots in Delhi.
“Motorists and general public are requested to remain patient, observe traffic rules and follow the directions of traffic personnel deployed at key intersections.”

Commuters are advised to plan their journeys accordingly and stay informed about traffic conditions.

item.title: Delhi State Commission Holds ICICI Lombard Liable For Deficiency In Service Over Wrongful Repudiation Of... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Delhi Commission Holds ICICI Lombard Liable for Service Deficiency

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The Delhi State Commission ruled that ICICI Lombard General Insurance is liable for service deficiency after wrongfully repudiating a claim without adhering to procedural requirements.

  • The complainant insured their car with ICICI Lombard and filed a claim post-accident.
  • Despite follow-ups and a legal notice, the insurer did not settle the claim.
  • The District Commission ordered ICICI Lombard to refund Rs.2,40,331 with interest, plus compensation and litigation costs.
  • The insurer's appeal to the State Commission was rejected, affirming the lower commission's decision.
  • The Commission stated that the complainant's actions were sufficient for compliance, rejecting the insurer's claims regarding procedural failures.
“The complainant’s failure to strictly adhere to the procedural requirements was not a valid reason to dismiss the claim.”

In conclusion, the ruling highlights the importance of accountability in the insurance sector and fair treatment of policyholders.

item.title: Nimisha Priya Case: What Option Does Kerala Nurse On Death Row In Yemen Latest News Update - The Indian Express
item.description:
Nimisha Priya Case: What option does Kerala nurse on death row in Yemen have?

Date: December 31, 2023 | Source: Indian Express

The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) is working to secure the release of Nimisha Priya, a Kerala nurse sentenced to death in Yemen for allegedly murdering a Yemeni citizen in 2017.

  • Priya was imprisoned in 2017 after allegedly killing Talal Abdo Mehdi, a Yemeni citizen.
  • She was sentenced to death in 2020, with her appeal dismissed by the Supreme Judicial Council in November 2023.
  • Negotiations for 'blood money' compensation are underway, with Priya's family expected to pay up to $400,000 to waive the death penalty.
“We understand that the family of Priya is exploring relevant options. The government is extending all possible help in the matter.” - MEA Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The situation highlights the complexities of legal recourse in foreign jurisdictions and raises significant humanitarian concerns.

item.title: From Delhi, Jaipur to Pune, rampant misuse of Aadhaar uncovered in drives against illegal Bangladeshis - ThePrint
item.description:
From Delhi, Jaipur to Pune, rampant misuse of Aadhaar uncovered in drives against illegal Bangladeshis

Date: December 2024

Source: ThePrint

This article uncovers extensive misuse of Aadhaar cards connected to illegal Bangladeshi immigrants in India, revealing various patterns of fraud, police crackdowns, and a growing concern over security.

  • Rackets facilitating illegal entry and validating fraudulent documents for Bangladeshi nationals in India.
  • Increased police activities following orders from the Delhi Lieutenant Governor to identify and deport illegal immigrants.
  • Numerous Aadhaar cards being confiscated as suspects are arrested across various regions including Delhi, Jaipur, and Pune.
  • Reported cases of individuals using fraudulent Aadhaar cards to misrepresent their age and identity.
  • Intensive verification drives resulting in deportations and arrests across multiple states including Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh.
“Under the guidance of @LtGovDelhi, team of @DCPSouthDelhi busted an illegal immigration racket, arresting 5 Bangladeshi Nationals and 6 accused involved in generating Aadhaar cards, voter IDs on the basis of fake birth certificates for Bangladeshi nationals.” - Delhi Police

The ongoing operations highlight a serious issue of identity fraud and illegal immigration influenced by ongoing political developments and police directives.

item.title: Warning for Manali and Solang Valley adventure loving tourists amid snow chaos - The Tribune India
item.description:
Warning for Manali and Solang Valley Tourists Amid Snow Chaos

Publication Date: January 1, 2023

Source: The Tribune

Himachal Pradesh’s popular winter getaway spots, Manali and Solang Valley, are facing severe disruption due to heavy snowfall.

Tourists are urged to reconsider their trips as travel conditions worsen.

  • Many vehicles are stranded on snow-covered roads.
  • Social media warnings from travellers about the risky situation.
  • Rescue operations are underway but heavy vehicles remain stuck.
  • The weather forecast predicts light to moderate snow and rain until January 4.
  • Tourists advised to stay informed and delay travel plans.
“Manali and Solang Valley, koi bhi mat aana! (Do not come!)” - Chlucky Tyagi

Given the ongoing severe weather, it is highly recommended that potential visitors postpone their trips to these areas until conditions improve.

item.title: "Why do you abuse me?": Arvind Kejriwal after BJP's backlash over Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana ahead of Delhi Assembly Elections 2025 - The Hindu
item.description:
Kejriwal Defends Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana Amid BJP Criticism

Publication Date: December 31, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal responded to BJP's backlash regarding the Pujari Granthi Samman Yojana ahead of the Delhi Assembly Elections 2025. Under this scheme, priests and granthis in Delhi will receive an honorarium of ₹ 18,000 per month.

  • Kejriwal criticizes BJP for its criticism of the new scheme.
  • He questions why BJP, in power for 30 years in Gujarat, did not support priests and granthis.
  • The scheme is set to launch today from the Hanuman Temple and a Gurudwara in Delhi.
  • BJP leader Virendraa Sachdeva labels Kejriwal as a desperate leader making populist announcements.
“BJP people have been abusing me since yesterday... Will the country benefit from abusing me?” - Arvind Kejriwal

The announcement aims to provide financial recognition to temple priests and granthis, reflecting an ongoing political contention ahead of the upcoming assembly elections.

item.title: Kerala Lottery Results Today: Sthree Sakthi SS-448 WINNERS for December 31, 2024; Full List Here! - News18
item.description:
Kerala Lottery Results Today: Here's FULL LIST of winning numbers for Sthree Sakthi SS-448 lucky draw for Tuesday, December 31.

Last Updated: December 31, 2024, 21:24 IST

The Kerala State Lottery Department has announced the results for the Sthree Sakthi SS-448 Lottery for Tuesday, December 31.

  • The first-place winner will receive a grand prize of Rs 75 lakh.
  • The second prize winner receives Rs 10 lakh.
  • The third prize is worth Rs 5,000.
Winning number for 1st prize worth Rs 75 lakh is SV 841794 (Kayamkulam).

Agent Name: BINU C, Agency No: A 6347

Winning number for 2nd prize worth Rs 10 lakh is SU 124617 (Adimaly).

Agent Name: ANEESH V C, Agency No: Y 5102

Conclusion: Winners are advised to verify their tickets and claim their prizes at the Kerala Lottery Office within 30 days.
